sentences.english: There is an ancient saying in China, " civility costs nothing ".
sentences.chinese: 中国有一条古训，“礼多人不怪”。

sentences.english: How to understand these old maxim ?
So, personally, I don’t like that old adage.
sentences.chinese: 所以说，我个人不同意这种古训。

sentences.english: The wisdom of the ancients is precious for us.
sentences.chinese: 古训对我们来说是宝贵的。

sentences.english: The ancient adage, a gentleman makes money through honourable means, still apply.
sentences.chinese: 君子爱财，取之有道，古训也，现在仍适用。

sentences.english: Of that sublimest lore which man had dared unlearn?
sentences.chinese: 人们竟敢忘记古训的崇高？

definition: as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
as the proverb says/as they say...
(idiom) complacency leads to loss, modesty brings profit/pride comes before a fall
pinyin: man3 zhao1 sun3 , qian1 shou4 yi4

definition: people from ancient times/the ancients/the late (i.e. person who has passed away)
one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人

definition: What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2
